instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7152: What is R7152? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots every 10 seconds.
threads.message:
Cant find any liquid on board.

Tested with genuine 85W charger.
Had only charging symbol on display even when left on charge for 30 minutes and press power button there was charging symbol.

Tested with two new and working batteries and it boots, but reboot every 10 secs.
Got Apple logo on screen and loading bar. 
During boot when I unplug charger it shut down but I am sure batteries got charge.

Tested with new keyboard, trackpad, removed SSD and unpluged small board and camera flex - same issue.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots every 10 seconds.
threads.message: So it seems like it doesn't run off the battery. Will it boot without the battery plugged in? Any history drop liquid etc? Inspect very closely for any hints of corrosion near the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, SMC, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, the BIOS, and <CHIP>U7090</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots every 10 seconds.
threads.message:
Exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Do you note battery voltage slowly increasing when both charger and battery are connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots every 10 seconds.
threads.message:
JohnB8812 - won?t boot without battery - board looks clean, no liquid - client say there was no drop

2informaticos - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> got 12.55V
?Do you note battery voltage slowly increasing when both charger and battery are connected?? yes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots every 10 seconds.
threads.message:
Does it run in SMC bypass mode?
Post voltage for pins 9 & 15 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Check exact value in ohm for <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots every 10 seconds.
threads.message: It should boot from just the charger. As 2informaticos suggested, measure resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots every 10 seconds.
threads.message:
Yes, it does run in SMC bypass mode.

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>/9 @ 0.035V
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>/15 @ 0.060V

<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> @ 10.5Ohm
<RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> @ 10Ohm

<RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR> @ 2.3Ohm
<RESISTOR>R7152</RESISTOR> @ 0.2Ohm

Resistance on <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>:
17/18 @ 3.7Ohm
27/28 @ 20.7Ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots every 10 seconds.
threads.message:
"Yes, it does run in SMC bypass mode."
So there is a sensor issue.
Check all sensors output from pages 42-45...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboots every 10 seconds.
threads.message:
Don?t know if did good measurements - got zero experience with sensors.

Had only known good battery connected and 85W charger.

<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL> @ 0.299V
